owner."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate that the this implementation remains valid after an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"refundFromSimpleMarket(uint256)":{"params":{"_marketIndex":"Index of the market"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. params._addressNFTCollection: address of the ERC1155 NFT collection contract
params._addressPaymentToken: address of the payment token contract
params._initialPrice: Inital price by the creator of the market
params._nftCount: quantity of the NFT for sale
params._nftId: Id of the NFT for sale

params._addressNFTCollection: address of the ERC1155 NFT collection contract
params._initialPrice: Inital price by the creator of the market
params._nftCount: quantity of the NFT for sale
params._nftId: Id of the NFT for sale

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate that the this implementation remains valid after an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

buyFromBaseAsset(uint256,uint256).notice: Buy a specific market item with Base Asset - Matic(Polygon)

buyFromToken(uint256,uint256).notice: Buy a specific market item with Token

claimNFTFromSimpleMarket(uint256).notice: Function used by the buyer to withdraw his NFT. When the NFT is withdrawn, the creator of the market will receive the payment tokens in his wallet

claimTokenFromSimpleMarket(uint256).notice: Function used by the creator of an market to withdraw his tokens when the market item is sold When the Token are withdrawn, the buyer of the item will receive the NFT in his walled

createSimpleMarketSale(address,address,u.notice: Create a new market of a specific NFT

createSimpleMarketSaleForBaseAsset(addre.notice: Create a new market of a specific NFT payment by Base Asset - Matic(Polygon)

refundFromSimpleMarket(uint256).notice: Function used by the creator of an market to get his NFT back in case the market item is not sold
